author: terencechain
content: I cannot speak for other clients, but in Prysm, we will never conflate the following two points: 1) syncing only to the finalized epoch, and 2) syncing to the head of the chain, which is akin to initially missing a block but subsequently discovering it due to attestation. Regarding range verification, it is assumed that the block already exists, which allows for the comparison of the hash tree root. Subsequently, one can verify the blob and the inclusion proof independently

content: The inclusion proof depends on the index though, as it starts with the neighboring kzg commitment's root
